subject: Programming
title: APIs as Contracts
description: A 1-minute de-risking session on APIs as Contracts.

hook.text: When you check the weather on your phone, the app doesn't measure temperature. It asks an API.

buildup.text: An API is a contract: send this request, get that response. The internals are hidden.

discovery.text: APIs let different systems talk without understanding each other's code. They agree on the format.

twist.text: Breaking an API contract breaks every app that depends on it. Change carefully or break millions.

climax.text: The modern internet is APIs calling APIs. Your one search query triggers dozens of them.

quiz.question: What does an API define?
options: A contract for how systems communicate
How files are stored on disk
